Description: Yellow painted pottery reis shabti of Shedkhons (name almost entirely eroded) with black details: a short wig tied with a fillet, a modelled face; one arm is held across the chest in relief and holds a whip; the figure wears a triangular apron inscribed with black painted hieroglyphs; the foot section has broken away.
Curator's comments: In set with .9462 In set with .9463 In set with .9464 In set with .9465 In set with .9466
Condition: incomplete - foot section missing, paint worn
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore
